get.description:
Returns Observation based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for Observation.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Observation.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select Observations based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select Observations based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the Observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the Observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the Observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of Observations that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: Used to request the server to return a subset of the resource. It can contain one of the following values: true, false, text, data or count.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Used to search the entire content of the Observation resource.

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Used to search on the narrative of the Observation resource.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular Observation, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular Observation, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The classification of the type of observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code of the observation type. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: code-value-concept
parameters.description: Combination of code and concept. Value should be in the form: [code]$[concept].

parameters.name: code-value-date
parameters.description: Combination of code and date. Value should be in the form: [code]$[date].

parameters.name: code-value-quantity
parameters.description: Combination of code and quantity. Value should be in the form: [code]$[quantity].

parameters.name: code-value-string
parameters.description: Combination of code and string. Value should be in the form: [code]$[string].

parameters.name: component-code
parameters.description: The component code of the observation type. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: component-code-value-concept
parameters.description: Combination of component code and concept. Value should be in the form: [code]$[concept].

parameters.name: component-code-value-date
parameters.description: Combination of component code and date. Value should be in the form: [code]$[date].

parameters.name: component-code-value-quantity
parameters.description: Combination of component code and quantity. Value should be in the form: [code]$[quantity].

parameters.name: component-code-value-string
parameters.description: Combination of component code and string. Value should be in the form: [code]$[string].

parameters.name: component-data-absent-reason
parameters.description: The reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: component-value-concept
parameters.description: The value of the component observation, if the value is a CodeableConcept.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: component-value-quantity
parameters.description: The value of the component observation, if the value is a Quantity, or a SampledData.Value can have following formats: [prefix][number]|[system]|[code]

parameters.name: component-value-string
parameters.description: The value of the component observation, if the value is a string, and also searches in CodeableConcept.text

parameters.name: data-absent-reason
parameters.description: The reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The Device that generated the observation data (Device, DeviceMetric).

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Healthcare event related to the observation (Encounter).

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The unique Id for a particular observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The subject that the observation is about (Patient).

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: Who performed the observation (Patient, Organization, Practitioner, RelatedPerson).

parameters.name: related
parameters.description: Related Observations - search on related-type and related-target together. Value should be in the form: [related-type]$[related-target].

parameters.name: related-target
parameters.description: Observation that is related to this one (Observation).

parameters.name: related-type
parameters.description: has-component | has-member | derived-from | sequel-to | replaces | qualified-by | interfered-by. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: specimen
parameters.description: Specimen used for this observation (Specimen).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject that the observation is about (Device, Location, Patient, Group).

parameters.name: value-concept
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a CodeableConcept. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: value-date
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a Period. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: value-date
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a Period. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: value-quantity
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a Quantity, or a SampledData. Value must be in the following format: [comparator][number]|[system]|[code].The default comparator is =.

parameters.name: value-string
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a string, and also searches in CodeableConcept.text.

parameters.name: stateid
parameters.description: Unique id associated with a page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Observation resource offset.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of Observation resources requested in a page.

parameters.name: _pretty
parameters.description: Set true to get prettified data.

parameters.name: _bundletype
parameters.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle. Values can be one of: document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of Observations based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.

FHIR documentation for Observation.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Observation.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of Observation

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Observation.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select Observations based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select Observations based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the Observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the Observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the Observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of Observations that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: Used to request the server to return a subset of the resource. It can contain one of the following values: true, false, text, data or count.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Used to search the entire content of the Observation resource.

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Used to search on the narrative of the Observation resource.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular Observation, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular Observation, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The classification of the type of observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code of the observation type. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: code-value-concept
parameters.description: Combination of code and concept. Value should be in the form: [code]$[concept].

parameters.name: code-value-date
parameters.description: Combination of code and date. Value should be in the form: [code]$[date].

parameters.name: code-value-quantity
parameters.description: Combination of code and quantity. Value should be in the form: [code]$[quantity].

parameters.name: code-value-string
parameters.description: Combination of code and string. Value should be in the form: [code]$[string].

parameters.name: component-code
parameters.description: The component code of the observation type. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: component-code-value-concept
parameters.description: Combination of component code and concept. Value should be in the form: [code]$[concept].

parameters.name: component-code-value-date
parameters.description: Combination of component code and date. Value should be in the form: [code]$[date].

parameters.name: component-code-value-quantity
parameters.description: Combination of component code and quantity. Value should be in the form: [code]$[quantity].

parameters.name: component-code-value-string
parameters.description: Combination of component code and string. Value should be in the form: [code]$[string].

parameters.name: component-data-absent-reason
parameters.description: The reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: component-value-concept
parameters.description: The value of the component observation, if the value is a CodeableConcept.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: component-value-quantity
parameters.description: The value of the component observation, if the value is a Quantity, or a SampledData.Value can have following formats: [prefix][number]|[system]|[code]

parameters.name: component-value-string
parameters.description: The value of the component observation, if the value is a string, and also searches in CodeableConcept.text

parameters.name: data-absent-reason
parameters.description: The reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The Device that generated the observation data (Device, DeviceMetric).

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Healthcare event related to the observation (Encounter).

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The unique Id for a particular observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The subject that the observation is about (Patient).

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: Who performed the observation (Patient, Organization, Practitioner, RelatedPerson).

parameters.name: related
parameters.description: Related Observations - search on related-type and related-target together. Value should be in the form: [related-type]$[related-target].

parameters.name: related-target
parameters.description: Observation that is related to this one (Observation).

parameters.name: related-type
parameters.description: has-component | has-member | derived-from | sequel-to | replaces | qualified-by | interfered-by. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: specimen
parameters.description: Specimen used for this observation (Specimen).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the observation. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject that the observation is about (Device, Location, Patient, Group).

parameters.name: value-concept
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a CodeableConcept. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: value-date
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a Period. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: value-date
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a Period. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: value-quantity
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a Quantity, or a SampledData. Value must be in the following format: [comparator][number]|[system]|[code].The default comparator is =.

parameters.name: value-string
parameters.description: The value of the observation, if the value is a string, and also searches in CodeableConcept.text.

200.description: The set of resources associated with a particular observation.

outhB2C.description: Security scheme for B2C flow using authorization code flow.
